isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Recondition - Replace Fuel Injector Sleeves

note.para: Replace injector sleeves if damaged or excessively worn.
If removing fuel injector sleeves with engine in-chassis, place a cup plug in injector bore before sleeve removal to prevent debris from entering cylinder.

step1.para: Lubricate thread tap, part of Injector Sleeve Remover .
Insert thread tap in fuel injector sleeve.
Screw thread tap into fuel injector sleeve. Cut threads at least ¾ inch deep to accommodate fuel injector sleeve puller.

note.para: Ensure fuel injector sleeve puller threads sufficiently into fuel injector sleeve.

step1.para: Insert fuel injector sleeve puller (part of Injector Sleeve Remover) into fuel injector sleeve and tighten. Make sure puller tool is threaded all the way into fuel injector sleeve.
Install a slide hammer on puller tool and remove fuel injector sleeve from injector bore.

Use a stiff wire brush from the Injector Sleeve Brush Set (set of 2)
, clean deposits and hardened sealant from the fuel injector bore.
Insert a small stiff nylon brush tool into oil gallery for cleaning.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

step1.para: Use compressed air to clean out all fuel and oil galleries.

Use an Injector Sleeve Installer
that does not have a bent pilot shaft or any nicks where the sleeve will seat.
Install a new fuel injector sleeve on the end of the Injector Sleeve Installer.

figure.caption: Apply sealant to fuel injector sleeve

step1.para:
Apply Loctite® 620 Retaining Compound
around outside bottom of injector sleeve and around beginning of taper at middle of sleeve.

figure.caption: Fuel injector sleeve and injector bore

step1.para: Insert fuel injector sleeve and Injector Sleeve Installer into injector bore.
Carefully drive fuel injector sleeve into injector bore with a hammer.
Clean fuel injector sleeve with a soft nylon brush.

Inspect inside surfaces of installed fuel injector sleeve. If nicked or scratched, replace sleeve again. Make sure Injector Sleeve Installer is not causing damage. Use a different Injector Sleeve Installer, if necessary.
